item.title: Christine add a quote by José Saramago
item.description: "doubt is the privilege of those who have lived a long time," -- José Saramago

item.title: Christine add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "In an individual, selfishness uglifies the soul; for the human species, selfishness is extinction." -- David Mitchell

item.title: Christine add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "Souls cross ages like clouds cross skies, an' tho' a cloud's shape nor hue nor size don't stay the same, it's still a cloud an' so is a soul. Who can say where the cloud's blowed from or who the soul'll be 'morrow? Only Sonmi the east an' the west an' the compass an' the atlas, yay, only the atlas o' clouds." -- David Mitchell

item.title: Christine add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I talk to God but the sky is empty." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Christine add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "I cannot believe in a God who wants to be praised all the time." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Christine add a quote by Liz Moore
item.description: "...this idea I had of an oversoul of loneliness. A connectedness among the world's lonely that I could turn to when I was very low. There was a delicious romance in being utterly alone, & I told myself I was nobler for it, & that there was a purpose to my solitude, O there must be." -- Liz Moore

item.title: Christine add a quote by Matthew Dicks
item.description: "There are two types of teachers in the world: there are those who play school and teachers that teach school" -- Matthew Dicks

item.title: Christine add a quote by Matthew Dicks
item.description: "You have to be the bravest person in the world to go out every day, being yourself when no one likes who you are." -- Matthew Dicks
